text: I’ve seen uninstalls and disables increase likely due to the fact the dev menu is broken in stable. I’m going to push the update live and “fix it in production” if there are problems
So Merry Christmas :chrome: extension users, the dev extension’s dev menu has been fixed, and there have been several performance and dark theme improvements. Enjoy.
yea, HubSpot made a change before the holidays to the header that broke the dev menu, got the fix into beta a day later but due to the holidays no one was using the beta so testing was slower.
maybe im the only “weird” here: im the only one using safari?
amongst developers majority use chrome, then it’s safari(with a relatively small marketshare), then firefox with like 1% marketshare difference.
personally I can’t get used to Safari’s dev tools
<@U6Z3FRJ2D> are you somehow using the chrome extension in safari?
nop, i cant. but i really want to use some kind of extension to safari :disappointed:

well, i’d support Safari with the extension if I could easily maintain the same codebase.
Fortunately for windows devs, Edge is going to start supporting Chrome extensions so the extension will be available there.

We have some devs that are interested in helping add support for firefox to the extension, I just don’t wanna do that solo as that could be a bit of work, and idk how hard it will be to maintain, since I don’t use firefox for dev. That one shouldn’t be too bad overall to port because firefox supports a lot of the same API’s.

each browser we support though will add steps to the process for updating the extension though.
<@U7SL518D6> you had to go and ruin my idea of submitting heaps of lame code to get that emoji
Do you guys want a script that keeps the website level to the earth no matter how tilted the device is? Do macbooks have a level sensor?
Maybe something that makes the CTAs larger for visitors with higher contact scores
Or if the score is too low, flash their name on the screen for a couple milliseconds every once in a while to scare them away.
that tilt idea could be a fun idea for a site if done in a not annoying way
